arm_group.description: Adults subjects from Hospitals, Private Practices suffering idiopathic cervical dystonia.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to document long-term response in real-life practice after
      injection cycles with BoNT-A in subjects suffering from idiopathic cervical dystonia
      (Long-term clinical and pharmaco-economic data).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject for whom there is an intention to treat with BoNT-A.

          -  BoNT treatment naïve or previously treated with BoNT.

          -  If previously treated with BoNT, at least a 12-week interval between the last
             injection (BoNT-A or BoNT-B) and inclusion.

          -  Subject able to comply with the protocol.

          -  Provision of written informed consent prior to collect the data.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Contraindications to any BoNT-A preparations.

          -  The subject has already been included in the study.

study_pop.textblock: Adult subjects from Hospitals, Private Practices suffering idiopathic cervical dystonia.

clinical_study.official_title: An International Observational Prospective Study On Long-Term Response To Botulinum Toxin Type A (BoNT-A) Injections In Subjects Suffering From Idiopathic Cervical Dystonia (CD) - Pharmaco-Economic Impact

authority: Austria: Agency for Health and Food Safety
Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices
Hungary: National Institute for Quality and Organizational Development in Healthcare and Medicines
Romania: National Agency for Medicines and Medical Devices
Slovenia: Agency for Medicinal Products - Ministry of Health
Czech Republic: State Institute for Drug Control
Mexico: Federal Commission for Protection Against Health Risks
Egypt: Ministry of Health, Drug Policy and Planning Center

primary_outcome.description: Identification of prognostic factors for subject's satisfaction regarding control of symptoms associated with idiopathic CD.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in subject's satisfaction using a 5-point Likert scale.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at every 3 to 4 months, up to 3 years.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Toronto Western Spasmodic Torticollis Rating Scale (TWSTRS) total score and severity sub-scale.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at every 3 to 4 months, up to 3 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in tremor associated with CD using Tsui score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at every 3 to 4 months, up to 3 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain relief assessed using the TWSTRS pain sub-scale.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at every 3 to 4 months, up to 3 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in disability will be measured with the TWSTRS disability sub-scale.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at every 3 to 4 months, up to 3 years.

secondary_outcome.description:
Time intervals between injections
Changes in concomitant treatments for CD and associated symptoms.
Changes in employment status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at every 3 to 4 months, up to 3 years.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
